channel.title: BEWARE OF SCAM everyone read
channel.description: After all the contrivercy of fagex.net being scam and all that happened. I went on to fagex recently and i could see that ie uploaded a cookie. Now correct me if im wrong but when you put automatically log me in on any website it remembers you using a cookie. I really cant give a screenie or provide evidence but im 100% sure about this. Please be catious im not saying that it is a scam but theres a very big chance

item.title: BEWARE OF SCAM everyone read
item.dc:creator: @hellothere hellothere
item.description:
@hellothere wrote:

Er, no, if your firewall accepts connections established by you, ie the only way you could be visiting sites or doing anything else on the net, you will get the cookie. Whether your browser allows the cookie or not is another matter.

Read full topic

item.description:
@zoss0 wrote:

Har har, he means the cookies that are on your comp that website upload to your computer, and if you have a good firewall I don’t really think that the cookie is gonna get through without letting you know.
Bah who caresTakes cookie from hemeny Ahh…Cookie

item.title: BEWARE OF SCAM everyone read
item.dc:creator: @hellothere hellothere
item.description:
@hellothere wrote:

Unless there is a vulnerability on the browser you are using each site can only look at its own cookies. Nothing to worry about unless the guys at fagex have any skill, which is not the case. Have a nice day.

Read full topic

item.title: BEWARE OF SCAM everyone read
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

lol im not a nine year old. It was doing it suspicously since it said UPLOADING now call me a noob if you like but how i saw it i assumed it was taking cookies other than its own. Especially since the recent things which have happened at fagex it seems possible. Either way it could just be like waffen denis said thanks for reading anyway. “i almost got a stickie :(”

Read full topic

item.title: BEWARE OF SCAM everyone read
item.dc:creator: @Waffendennis Waffendennis
item.description:
@Waffendennis wrote:

I’m sure you’ve taken things wrong, because when a site is asking to store or do any thing with a cookie on IE it’s normal, trust me on that.

If it was a exploit that would obtain your cookie you wouldn’t notice it.

Nothing to worry about :),

Thanks for the awareness though ;).

Read full topic
